Credmark’s Head of Risk Solutions

Asan Tulemis I 10.12.2021

My name is Asan Tulemis and I am thrilled to be joining Credmark as their Head of Risk Solutions. I think the best way to introduce myself would be through a series of questions that I believe many people will have about myself and this position.

Let’s begin!

What does “Head of Risk Solutions” mean? What does risk mean in the context of Defi?

It’s like a gold rush in a Wild West, ample opportunity under the risk of those who are in power to get away with it. I will be working with quants and AI/ML engineers to equate the power distribution between ordinary people and institutional players by better tooling for the former.

Basically giving away bazookas to the villagers.

Why Am I Qualified for this Role?

I have fifteen years of experience across various roles in financial markets. I know its infrastructure, participants, their perspectives, products, and their behavior.

My previous assignment was to assist a sizable institutional bank in improving quant team capabilities and transform technical value proposition. It resulted in a fifty percent reduction in specialists onboarding and traders’ effort waste.

Why Am I Joining Credmark?

Some might think this was crazy to change an established career path. I’m not a conventional person, so for me, it’s logical, and here is why.

  • Firstly, I have a passion for innovation and impact. Having experience in traditional finance, knowing its good and not so good sides, and how it could be improved makes sense to join a start-up. From scratch, you can create the best and focus on a real value-add without dealing with legacy. I would like to bring everyone on this journey, my team, other colleagues at Credmark, investors, and even members of our community.
  • Secondly, Credmark has a powerful vision of bringing data and risk analytics DAO to the public. This is a strong value proposition for ordinary people, tired of the traditional finance system and stepping into the world of Defi. Providing value to the community is one of the core values I always had and who could imagine that it also could be your full-time work.

What does Success Look Like?

In the short run, it is CMK users recommending our data and tooling to their friends.

In the long run, ensuring we have robust model validation, approval, and review governance, also operating autonomously.

Poor performance is the opposite.
